alternative_physics_models.name: Quantum Gravity Theory
alternative_physics_models.description: A theoretical framework that attempts to describe gravity according to the principles of quantum mechanics.
alternative_physics_models.theoretical_foundation: Combines general relativity and quantum mechanics.

alternative_physics_models.name: String Theory
alternative_physics_models.description: A theoretical framework in which point-like particles are replaced by one-dimensional strings.
alternative_physics_models.theoretical_foundation: Unifies all fundamental forces and particles.

alternative_physics_models.name: Loop Quantum Gravity
alternative_physics_models.description: A theory that attempts to quantize gravity by describing the fabric of spacetime as a network of finite loops.
alternative_physics_models.theoretical_foundation: Based on the principles of quantum mechanics and general relativity.

alternative_physics_models.name: Modified Newtonian Dynamics (MOND)
alternative_physics_models.description: A hypothesis that proposes modifications to Newton's laws to account for observed galaxy rotation curves.
alternative_physics_models.theoretical_foundation: Challenges the existence of dark matter.

alternative_physics_models.name: Quantum Field Theory in Curved Spacetime
alternative_physics_models.description: A framework that combines quantum field theory with general relativity to describe particle physics in a gravitational field.
alternative_physics_models.theoretical_foundation: Integrates quantum mechanics with general relativity.
